text:
OSKAR WALLIN: Afry is one of
Europe's larger engineering

firms with about
18,000 employees.

They work within infrastructure,
energy, automotive, basically

any big engineering
required area.

I work within a small
department in Afry,

about 200 people that just
does pure visualization.

For example, there's
a long new train line
being built in Northern Sweden.

It's very complicated,
and it's very, very long.

And our aim is to replicate
the actual environment
that's around the train line.

And for that, we need
to put in forests,

we need to put in rocks,
we need to put in roads.

And that's really
geometry heavy.

Not a lot of softwares can
handle it in one single place.

That's where Unreal
Engine comes in.

We can take the data
from the engineers,

we can take the data from
the land survey department,

and we can put it all
together in one place.

And they can all see the
same uncomplicated view.

One of the big challenges
we have is communication.

There's a lot of different
departments specializing
in different things.

And the communication
between those departments

aren't always as
good as it should be.

For example, in the
Halmstad Harbor,

had three different
consultancy firms
working around the same areas.

So through Unreal Engine,
these three companies

could meet up and share what
they're doing in their projects,

and be able to adapt to
the other projects working

within the same
geographical area.

So these large projects, they
also affect a lot of people,

and the company wants to
be able to communicate that

to the inhabitants
of the municipality.

We're able to create videos
and interactive environments

in Unreal Engine
that they can share

with the environmental
board and with inhabitants.

Since we started using Unreal,
the inhabitants in the areas

that are affected by these
large infrastructure projects,

they feel a lot more
informed, and the worry

is reduced quite a lot, which in
the end, results in less appeals

and therefore, quicker
and smoother project.

Unreal Engine is a tool that
lets us communicate quicker.

We're able to do iterations and
move more data in a faster way

than we've been
able to do before.

We want to be able to use this
in workshops with inhabitants

there, be able to fly
down to their house,

and see how these large projects
impact their daily life.

Unreal Engine in real
time is the only place
where we can do this.
